text:
Hi Alex. Cinesite is still working on shows but quite a few shoots have been postponed due to the virus. I am expecting a gap work wise around end of summer/early autumn. 

I think that talent is important, but being a good team member is more important. You can be the best artist in the world, if you don’t work well in a team, you won’t last. 

Never stop learning. Ever. Tools change. Skills change. You don’t want to get stuck with a dying software. 

Today, I would learn Unreal or Unity. There is a big shift towards real-time coming soon.
I am moving house this week and will then be on holidays, so I will probably take longer to reply.

That's very interesting cheers. 

We're actually going to be learning unreal in my 3rd year so I'm glad I will be able to say I have that as a potential skill and hopefully I will have some work from it next year to put on a showreel.

My uni has called it, all lessons will be online until further notice.

I don't know how this will effect work without access to all the software and without the face to face support of our tutors.
